member.name: T:Leadtools.Wia.WiaException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a WIA error occurs.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WiaException class with its Message string set to an empty string (""), its Code set to WiaExceptionCode.NotInitialized, and its inner exception set to a null reference (Nothing in VB).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WiaException class with the specified serialization and context information.
member.param: The data for serializing or deserializing the object.
The source and destination for the object.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WiaException class with its Message string set to *message*, its Code set to WiaExceptionCode.NotInitialized and its inner exception set to a null reference (Nothing in VB).
member.param: A System.String that describes the error. The content of the message is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WiaException class with a specified error message, its Code set to WiaExceptionCode.NotInitialized and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in VB), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaException.#ctor(System.String,Leadtools.Wia.WiaExceptionCode)

An WiaExceptionCode value that specifies what caused this exception.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaException.#ctor(Leadtools.Wia.WiaExceptionCode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WiaException class with its Message string set to the default message that corresponds to *code* and its inner exception set to a null reference (Nothing in VB).
member.param: An WiaExceptionCode that specifies what caused this exception.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaSession.Acquire(System.IntPtr,System.Object,Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireFlags)
member.summary: Acquires one or more images from a WIA source.
member.param: Window handle of your application window.
This parameter is only used when acquiring from scanner device and the **ShowUserInterface** flag is NOT set. Use this parameter to specify the scanner's paper source (Feeder or Flatbed).
Flag that determines certain actions of the WIA image acquisition selection dialog box. Possible values are:
member.returns: One of the DialogResult values. If an error occurs, an exception is thrown.

member.summary: Extracts a still image from the video stream, and saves the image as a JPEG file.
member.returns: A System.String containing the full path and filename of the captured JPEG file from the camera device.

member.summary: Acquires one or more images from a WIA source.
member.param: The WIA version to be used. Possible values are:
Window handle of your application window.
This parameter is only used when acquiring from a scanner device while the **ShowUserInterface** flag is NOT set. Use this parameter to specify the scanner's paper source (Feeder or Flatbed).
Specifies which type of WIA device to use. Possible values are:
Flag that determines certain actions of the WIA image acquisition selection dialog box. Possible values are:
member.returns: One of the DialogResult values. If an error occurs, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Leadtools.Wia.WiaSession.AcquireToFile(System.IntPtr,System.Object,Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireFlags)
member.summary: Acquires one or more images from a WIA source directly to file(s).
member.param: Window handle of your application window.
This parameter is only used if you are acquiring from a scanner device and the **ShowUserInterface** flag is NOT set. Use this parameter to specify the scanner's paper source (Feeder or Flatbed).
Flag that determines certain actions of the WIA image acquisition selection dialog box. Possible values are:
| WiaAcquireFlags.None | Default behavior for the device image acquisition dialog box. |
member.returns: One of the DialogResult values. If an error occurs, an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Wia.WiaSuppressPropertyPageMode

member.name: T:Leadtools.Wia.WiaVerticalBedRegistrationMode
member.summary: Contains the registration, or vertical alignment and edge detection, for documents placed on the flatbed. For more information please refer to WIA_DPS_VERTICAL_BED_REGISTRATION property ID in Microsoft Windows SDK Documentation.This property is not supported with Windows Vista and later.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode
member.summary: Specifies how the digital camera weights color channels. For more information please refer to WIA_DPC_WHITE_BALANCE property ID in Microsoft Windows SDK Documentation.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.Manual
member.summary: The white balance is set directly using the WiaPropertyId.CameraDeviceRGBGain property.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.Auto
member.summary: The camera uses an automatic mechanism to set the white balance.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.OnePushAuto
member.summary: The camera determines the white balance setting when a user presses the capture button while pointing the camera at a white surface.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.Daylight
member.summary: The camera sets the white balance to a value appropriate for use in daylight conditions.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.Florescent
member.summary: The camera sets the white balance to a value appropriate for use with a fluorescent light source.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.Tungsten
member.summary: The camera sets the white balance to a value appropriate for use with a tungsten light source.

member.name: F:Leadtools.Wia.WiaWhiteBalanceMode.Flash
member.summary: The camera sets the white balance to a value appropriate for use with an electronic flash.

member.name: T:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions
member.summary: Provides information about the options that affect the acquisition process.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.Append
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether to append the acquired pages to the end of an existing file that supports multi-page files.
member.value: Flag that indicates whether to append the acquired pages to the end of an existing file that supports multi-page files. Possible values are: true to append pages to the end of the file, false to not append pages to the end of the file. This is the default value.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.DoubleBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether to enable double buffering.
member.value: Flag that indicates whether to use double buffering while doing memory transfer. Possible values are: true to enable double buffering, false to not enable double buffering.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.Empty
member.summary: Returns a WiaAcquireOptions structure with default values.
member.value: A WiaAcquireOptions structure with default values.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.FileName
member.value: A System.String that specifies the filename.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.MemoryBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory buffer size to be used in data transfer.
member.value: An integer that represents the size of the memory buffer, in bytes, to be used in data transfer.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.OverwriteExisting
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether to overwrite any existing files found with the same name(s).
member.value: Flag that indicates whether to overwrite any existing files found with the same name(s). Possible values are: true to overwrite the existing file, false to generate new name(s) for the saved file(s) by adding an incremented number within braces. This is the default value.

member.name: P:Leadtools.Wia.WiaAcquireOptions.SaveToOneFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether to save multiple pages to a single file.
member.value: Flag that indicates whether to save multiple pages to a single file. Possible values are: true to save to a single file, false to save acquired pages to separate files. The default value is false.
